snippet: The losses in the latest quarter bring total losses to $11.6 billion so far in the agency’s fiscal year, which ends Sept. 30.
abstract: Postal Service reports a $5.2 billion net loss in the quarter ending June 30; had reported $3.1 billion loss in the same period a year earlier; revenue in the quarter fell to $15.6 billion, a decrease of $153 million, or a 1 percent decline; attributes loss to a 2006 law requiring that the agency pre-fund future retirees' health benefits, amounting to a $5 billion payment each year for 10 years.
lead_paragraph: The losses in the latest quarter bring total losses to $11.6 billion so far in the agency’s fiscal year, which ends Sept. 30.

headline.seo: Postal Service Reports $5.2 Billion Loss for Quarter
headline.main: Post Office Troubles Mount With $5.2 Billion Quarterly Loss
headline.print_headline: Post Office Troubles Mount With $5.2 Billion Quarterly Loss
